intro: [WRONG START] Hieracius congruens, commonly known as the clustered hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are basal and spoon-shaped, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Hieracium congruens is often found in open habitats and can sometimes become invasive in certain regions.
